name: More on the JFK Assassination Quiz / Test | U.S. Presidents | 10 Questions

questions.text: President Kennedy made many enemies with the 'Bay of Pigs' disaster. What unsuccessful plan did this include?
options: An embargo and blockade for certain hostile eastern countries
A plan to assassinate keyleaders in Vietnam
A plan to utilize 'dirty tricks' to embarrass Khruschev
questions.explanation:
A plan to invade Cuba.

	The Bay of Pigs was a fiasco. Kennedy inherited certain plans that were made during the Eisenhower administration for the invasion of Cuba. Early in JFK's presidency, the plan went forward - but failed when JFK did not provide air support. The entire affair made many enemies for JFK.

questions.text: Following the Bay of Pigs, JFK threatened to 'splinter' this organization 'into a million pieces'. Which organization was this?
questions.explanation:
CIA.

	JFK blamed the CIA for the Bay of Pigs. He fired Director Allen Dulles (who later served on the Warren Commission).

questions.text: Who was the alleged head of organized crime in New Orleans and Dallas at the time of JFK's assassination?
questions.explanation:
Carlos Marcello.

	All were alleged to be key players in organized crime at that time.

questions.text: Who was the police officer that was allegedly killed by Oswald at the time of the assassination?
questions.explanation:
JD Tippitt.

	It's unclear if Oswald committed the murder (or what the motive may have been if he was the murderer).

questions.text: After being apprehended, what did Oswald state?
questions.correct: He had done nothing - he was only a 'patsy'
options: He was part of a larger operation to assassinate the president
questions.explanation:
He had done nothing - he was only a 'patsy'.

	Oswald proclaimed his innocence.

questions.text: There has been speculation about the role of this man in the assassination: he hated John (and Robert) Kennedy, and his career would have probably ended if Kennedy had remained president. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
J Edgar Hoover.

	Hoover hated the Kennedys - and knew that JFK (if re-elected) would force him into retirement.

questions.text: According to conspiracy theorists, which of the following had antagonism toward John F Kennedy that could have provided a motive for assassination?
options: Big business and right wing factions
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	It is sometimes argued that Kennedy had many enemies. The Cuban government was disgusted with him after the Bay of Pigs - as was the CIA. Organized crime felt that he had betrayed them: they helped with his election and then became victims of a 'war on crime'. Right wing people didn't believe that he was tough enough on communism, etc.

questions.text: Who was the person of eventual prominence who served on the Warren Commission?
questions.explanation:
Gerald Ford.

	It was Ford. Rusk and McNamara were in JFK's Cabinet.

questions.text: An early critic of the findings of the Commission was Mark Lane. What did he write?
options: On the Trail of the Assassins
questions.explanation:
Rush to Judgment.

	'Assassins' was Garrison's book. 'Fair Play' was the name of the brochures distributed by Oswald prior to the assassination.

questions.text: The House Select Committee on Assassination met in 1979. What did they conclude?
questions.correct: There had been a conspiracy that included more than one gunman
options: The findings of the Warren Commission were accurate
questions.explanation:
There had been a conspiracy that included more than one gunman.

	The HSCA concluded that there were at least two gunmen involved (and, hence, a conspiracy).
